thread.title: Hiker Loses Hand In Pennsylvania Campfire Explosion
thread.title_full: Hiker Loses Hand In Pennsylvania Campfire Explosion

author: CBS Pittsburgh
title: Hiker Loses Hand In Pennsylvania Campfire Explosion
text:
Hiker Loses Hand In Pennsylvania Campfire Explosion March 17, 2017 11:43 AM Filed Under: Appalachian Trail Photo Credit: Thinkstock 
KEMPTON, Pa. (AP) – A Pennsylvania hiker is recovering after his left hand was blown off while trying to start a campfire. 
The accident happened on the Appalachian Trail, which runs about 2,200 miles from Maine to Georgia. Ethan Kunkel, deputy chief of the Kempton Fire Company, tells The (Allentown) Morning Call that the man grabbed the wrong substance out of his backpack and it exploded. The chief didn’t say what the substance was. 
Kunkel says the explosion, which happened about 10:20 p.m. Wednesday, shattered the man’s hand and that doctors are unlikely to try to reattach it.
